div.p: We thank Paula Holahan, Laura Monahan, and Emily Lannoye at the University of Wisconsin‚ÄêMadison Zoological Museum for specimen loan management and care. We also thank Dr. Anthony Ives for his guidance on our analysis and presentation of results. We thank Dr. Volker Radeloff for his assistance with the housing density data. We also thank Dr. Warren Porter and Dr. Anna Pidgeon for their input on this study. We would like to acknowledge B. Marks (Chicago Field Museum); A. Johnson and C. Witt (Museum of Southwestern Biology); C. Gebhard and C. Melinsky (Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History); R. Faucett, J. Klicka and C. Wood (University of Washington Burke Museum); K. Winker and J. Withrow (University of Alaska Zoology Museum); C. Dardia, V. Rohwer and D. Winkler (Cornell University Museum of Vertebrates); J. Trimble (Harvard Museum of Comparative Zoology); J. McCormack and J. Maley (Moore Lab of Zoology); J. Woods (Delaware Museum of Natural History); R. Corado (Western Foundation of Vertebrate Zoology); B. Skipper (Angelo State Natural History Collections); and A. Doll and G. Spellman (Denver Museum of Nature & Science). We are grateful for external reviews from Matthew Symonds and one anonymous reviewer. A Trewartha Senior Thesis Grant to CRM funded this work, and we received additional support from the Department of Forest and Wildlife Ecology.
